Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: susanned
Reviews.Content: way too expensive - you are better off staying at the Camino Real in the same terminal. If you disregard the price tag: room is nice, beds very comfortable, staff nice, free wifi & business centre, snacks in the lobby in the evening, right inside the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Best Asset is Location”
Reviews.Author: engineer64
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located inside terminal 1 and is great for convenience for flights. There are several rstaurants within terminal 1 to choose for meals. The hotel provides a van service to terminal 2 - so you do not have tp take the airport train. It takes about 10 minutes to get there. There were just a few English channels and the FREE internet was spotty on performance. During nusy time at 9pm, it was useless. During early morning it worked great. The bed was just OK. There was no place to place the suitcase which was strange. The staff was very friendly and were happy you are there. For flights to/from MEX, this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient. But not so good.”
Reviews.Author: Denyson
Reviews.Content: I believe they should have a swimming pool, so you san spend some time during your staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport location - that's it...”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_Man069
Reviews.Content: Average rooms and fairly expensive for the quality. The restaurant service was sloooooow and the food quality was poor. Your paying for the location, which if you need a place to stay at the airport it's the only game in town...

Reviews.Title: “Convenience is the only benefit”
Reviews.Author: LiamBuckley
Reviews.Content: Located withion the international arrivals terminal at Mexico City this hotel provides basic services and in my view does not live up to the Hilton name. Unless you have a very late arrival or a very early departure there are plenty of alternatives and even then there are hotels within walking distance that are better. The rooms are stark, and minimally furnshed although they do contain mini bars. My first room was bothered by someone hammering (maybe in the terminal) and I moved rooms. All rooms are subject to corridor noise with at least 0.75" gaps under the doors and as the doors have no return dampner they are subject to a hefty slam. I came down for breakfast and found that there was no black tea available - got a long story about how they had some customers drink it all - what a concept - customers that consume drinks. Spread other than that was decent but well picked over by the time I got down. Check in/out desk was friendly enough but for the price the roomwas just poor, noisy, small bathroom and for the money I could take a 15 minute cab ride and stay in the xity at a much nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “A good overnight option at the Mexico City (MEX) airport”
Reviews.Author: RockvilleTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Mexico City Airport Hitlon is the only hotel located directly in Terminal One of the Benito Juarez International Airport. If you are arriving late at night or leaving early in the morning, it can be a good option. The hotel itself is located near the main food court with a direct elevator to the hotel lobby. The hotel itself is old and the rooms feel a bit shabby. They are gradually updating the rooms and the quality is generally improving. However, it does not compare well to hotels in the city at this price range (Mexico City has some very nice hotels!). However the rooms are clean and everything works. The internet is better than average for Mexico City, in my opinion. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The food is not particularly good. Personally, I just go down in the elevator to the food level which has a large variety of fast food and sit down restaurants, plus a variety of stores. I have probably stayed here around twenty times and will continue to stay here as necessary. Please note that this hotel is in Terminal One. If you are taking a flight from Terminal Two (mostly AeroMexico and other Sky Team carriers), you will need a ticket or boarding pass to take the train between the two terminals and the guards are strict about not letting people without proper tickets. Otherwise, there is a bus (around ten pesos) or a taxi. The same is true is you arriving in Terminal Two and need to go to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rodger H
Reviews.Content: I have found that there are some excellent hotels in Mexico, often better than those in the US. Not so with this Hilton. The hallway leading to my room smelled bad. I got in the room and it was old and worn. The mattress was sagging and the pillows smelled bad. Maybe they don't care because they are literally inside the airport terminal and you can't get any more convenient than that. You could leave your luggage in your room and go down to the ticket counter to check in. Nice staff and decent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel stinks (literally)!”
Reviews.Author: gravyboat
Reviews.Content: The only thing this hotel has going for it is its location inside of the airport. Very convenient for early morning flights especially. The staff were generally pleasant and helpful but other than the location and staff, this really is a motel 6 or the like quality hotel/motel. The rooms are in desperate need of a makeover - cigarette burns on the carpet, marked and chipped paint throughout, very poor lighting, old bathrooms with cracked and dirty tiles and mould in the grouting of the tub/shower. cheap and battered furniture (other than bed), towels were like sandpaper and sound proofing from hall and other rooms was not very good. The mattresses and bedding looked like they had been recently replaced and were fairly comfortable. Worst of all was the smell. Mexico City can often smell bad but generally it is fairly mild, you get used to it and don't notice after a while (like in Venice). In this case, it smelled like there was an open sewage plant beside the hotel. If you had the air conditioning going full blast and the rooms consequently an icebox, the filtering seemed to block most of the smell. but we had to shut off the air conditioning because it was below 60 degrees in our room and our daughters were freezing. the smell was so bad it made me gag and woke me up throughout the night. Between the smell and disgusting state of the room, I hardly slept and was more than happy to leave at 5 am. This was definitely the worst Hilton I have ever stayed in (at any brand level). Unless you are desperate, I would recommend you stay somewhere else until they overhaul the hotel. Hilton guests expect more and the hard working staff at the hotel deserve better.

Reviews.Title: “crash right into bed on landing”
Reviews.Author: CLAUDE B
Reviews.Content: For many years, to fly to Cacun, meant to transit via Miami. For those not willing to submit themselves to the unfriendly treatment of US immigration officials, with idiotic questionnairs, finger printing, naked scanning and biometric photography, making you look like a fruitbat, there is an alternate: go via Mexico-City. The waiting lines are much shorter, you press a button and a random system determines whether your luggage is going to haver an insoection or not.The name tags carry equal names than the Gonzales and Gomez of Miami, but they treat tourist5s and business people with dignity, unjlike their US counterpart.Having past the green light, you may direct yourself towards the middle of the first terminal from where an escalator and a lift brings directly into the Hilton hotel lobby. registration is simple and friendly and you find yourself in a modern, comfortable airconditioned room. The hotel is sound prooved from the outer noise and one will need a few hours good sleep to try to shake off part of the jet lag. Before hitting the road, respectively the skies again in the morning after generous American or Mexican breakfast .The convenient location of this hotel helps making the long trip a pleasurable journey.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice airport choice”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoHueb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in Terminal 1 of Mexico City Airport. It offers shuttle service to terminal 2. Rooms are not big, but clean and cozy. Beds are delicious and staff very attentive. Since my flight was due to late evening, they let me check out at 8pm at no extra cost. If I need a night in Mexico City between flights, the Hilton will definitely be first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location next to airport. Comfortable with great food.”
Reviews.Author: Felixsnz
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice during November on arrival and before flying out. Staff were lovely. Bed very comfortable! I do find it weird they lock the mini bar but sure they have good reason. Breakfast buffet was amazing! Totally worth it! So grateful for the water also on arrival and in room. After two hours processing in customs it was a life saver!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: artifactory
Reviews.Content: I usually look for things that are missplaced perhaps a little too much when I travel and stay in a certain hotel. This hotel however was quite great. I mean it didn't feel like a 5 star hotel but the people were nice, all People in Mexico is nice. The lobby is somewhat small and crowded, the reception is placed on one side of the entrance somewhat oddly place... The room I stayed at was charming and it had two large beds.. I had to be at the gate at 2am so my sleep was pretty bad; not sure if for the exciment or the noise from the hallways... Overall it was a great stay. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, clean, convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: travelsketchwrite
Reviews.Content: Our flight into Mexico City arrived later in the day, so we decided to spend the night at the airport before catching our shuttle to San Miguel de Allende. Reviews had been mixed but our experience at the Hilton was good. Staff was very attentive, decorations for the holidays were festive and the proximity to the airport and good restaurants in the airport was appreciated. Our king size bed was very comfortable and the gym is up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a night stay on your way to somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: El_Josu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night at the Hilton Mexico City Airport on our way to Cancun, since we had an early flight. Staff was very accommodating and service was good. The room was spacious and had great views of the runways. Breakfast was OK. This hotel is convenient, and we highly recommend it for an overnight stay if you have an early flight from terminal one the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Not international standard”
Reviews.Author: LiquidTraveller
Reviews.Content: There was a time when Hilton stood for five star hotel excellence. Those times must be long gone. I chose the Hilton at Mexico City airport, as my connecting flight was cancelled. Staff was very slow at reception counter. They first gave me a room right next to the restaurant and bar area. There's literally just a thin wall between your bed and the busiest part of the hotel. When I complained, they immediately put me in another room. That was a plus. I had a drink at the bar and ordered some food. Good thing is you can order food until the late hours. Bad thing is it comes as a microwaved sort of slosh. Worst hotel food I ever had. Drinks measures were generous, but glass not clean. The room was fairly spacious but made of cheap materials. I paid something around 170 US dollars for the night. Some Mexican friends later on told me that there is also a Camino Real and a NH hotel at the airport. If I have to spend a night at that airport again, I'd rather try the other options.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean, Convenient but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: rallyrabbit
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a very friendly, help full staff. The lobby restaurant and lounge is nice, overlooking the runway. In fact, the entire hotel setup is nice in that it overlooks the runway (it is directly over a concourse of the airport). Given that, and that it is next to a rather busy highway, the rooms and hotel is quiet. The rooms are clean. bathroom is huge. But the hotel is hugely expensive compared to other local hotels that are not as convenient to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location for air travellers”
Reviews.Author: Rupesh72
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel when i had an over nite lay over in Mexico city.The hotel room was very cosy and comfortable with a mini bar and tea/coffee facility in the room. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a view of the runways from the restaurent. There is a good choice of other food outlets on the airport terminal as the hotel lift opens directly on to the airport terminal on level 1. The hotel provides a shuttle service to terminal two but it is better to take the terminal train and escape the unpredictable traffic rush.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MarMurAgu
Reviews.Content: If you have to stay overnight in Mexico City, this hotel is INside the airport. Nice rooms and very quiet. Food so, so, but in the airport are many options, including a Centurion Amex lounge with great service and good food, for free if you are Centurion or Platinum card member.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CMH_Traveller43221
Reviews.Content: I stay at this property at least 8 times a year due to its convenience. The lobby bar is fabulous in the afternoon. You may watch all the flights take off and land enjoying a cool beverage. The breakfast buffet is most excellent. As a Diamond Hilton Honor member they need to learn how to do e-checkins...This is one of the few Hilton properties that do not do e-checkins. I will stop using this property if they do not do them,

Reviews.Title: “Would expect much more from a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: G9508
Reviews.Content: The hotel is reasonable for an overnight before or after a flight. It is accessed directly from the terminal, and is only minutes from the checkin areas, which is very convenient. Though the rooms overlook the airfield, the noise isolation is very efficient. The room I have got was clean, the bed - reasonable. But it definitely did not look Hilton - very minimalistic, and without any style. However, the price was high, probably considering the location and the fact that we had no advanced reservations. The breakfast was 5 stars, though not included in the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever book this hotel on the Internet.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew20850
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient and the rooms are nice. I have stayed there on four previous occasions. I booked the hotel through trip advisor, and then agreed to a no refund or change reservation. My time to leave was firm. I had already booked my return flight a month in advance. But about ten days before I was to leave, an work caused me to go home a day early and I had to change my reservation. I tried with phone calls and emails to just move my reservation up one day. NO, it is against policy to let you change! I tried to call the desk at the hotel, the Hilton main number, no luck. When I got to the airport a little after noon on the day I wanted to leave, the desk clerk would not let me change. I had to go to another hotel, Camino de Real, and pay roughly the same amount for not nearly as nice a room. I informed the HIlton desk as I was leaving, that I would not be staying there the next night. They gave me no response. So, it is a convenient hotel, the rooms are okay, but do not book through the Internet if you are not absolutely sure of the actual date. You will not be able to change.

Reviews.Title: “On a Scale of 1-5 for airport hotels this was a 3+ but Breakfast is a 5+”
Reviews.Author: Bcr8tve
Reviews.Content: I would stay there again in transit and be wiser that the directional signage in the Mexico City Airport is terrible. I arrived in the newer Terminal 2 but the hotel is in Terminal 1. There are no information booths and you're lucky if you can find someone knowledgeable to speak English. We actually followed the signage to NM hotel in terminal 1 then figured out you had to take the "airbus" to Terminal 1 - not a short distance either. A ten minute ride to the other terminal and the "airbus" only runs every 15minutes or so. The "airbus" is a monorail and the entrance is in a secure area where you need to show a boarding pass or your hotel confirmation. NOTE: we only had 1 bag each and a carry-on - if you have lots of bags that you can't manage yourself it would be difficult to go to this hotel. I heard from a business traveler that the baggage people can only get your bags to the secure area of the monorail and then you have to drag your bags up the small ramp and onto the monorail. Baggage handlers were again at Terminal 1 once you exited the "airbus". Hilton lobby was modern feel with grand player piano in lobby bar and the staff was very cordial dressed in suits/ties and very professional. We didn't receive the upgrade to a king bed as they were fully occupied and double beds are very small. We actually slept separtely to have more room. I liked the Crabtree and Evelyn products in the baths. I used 30K hilton pts and as Gold member had brkfst included. I think the room would have run around $155USD and breakfast 253pesos pp. We did have an issue with the HVAC not cooling and they resolved within minutes of phoning the front desk by sending an engineer to punch in some code so that the temperature was actually what it said it was on the digital read-out. Zero noise level from the planes. the walls are concrete and we didn't hear any people noise except some doors closing loudly in the early a.m. Comfortable beds and pillows. We arrived at 3pm and after checking in walked the Terminal 1. There is a lot of activity, small shops, people, money exchanges, banks, food kiosks and a few nicer restaurants. We also checked out the Camino Real to see if it was better and I didn't get the impressions it was any nicer than the Hilton. In fact it looked a bit more tired with a less appealing common area. AT Terminal 1 I must recommend Casa Avilla Mediterrean restaurant. We had a lovely bottle of red wine, fish dinner, white linen service, all male staff and mostly male business people at the time we visited. However, to my surprise a Mariache band came through and we had them play a song - then the couple next to us, sponsored 2 songs of my choice and it was lovely and romantic. At the Hilton they had a complimentary fruit drink at check-in which was a nice touch. Hilton airport breakfast was excellent a definate 5+. Waiters were dressed in tux shirts and vests. The kitchen staff which popped out every once in awhile were in jumpsuits that looked like green color hazmet suits. So I got the impression that it was a very clean well managed kitchen. Beautiful dishes and presentation on buffet bar. Cheeses, cereals, smoked salmon, papaya,figs, various fruites, nuts, omelets to order, pancakes, extra crispy bacon, potatoes, 3 different juices, excellent coffee...everything you could want to start your day. We had early departure and used the Hilton shuttle to return to Terminal 2. The shuttle runs every 1/2hr in the mornings which was very convenient. With a beautiful dinner, breakfast, mariache band etc...it was a lovely stay to our Mexico vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton ever”
Reviews.Author: CaroARG1978
Reviews.Content: When I wrote the review for Hilton I just said... you should change the name of the hotel. It is bad for the brand that this terrible hotel is named hilton. First, if you are not arriving/ leaving in terminal 1, there is a brand new hotel in terminal 2, so donÂ´t even think about going to the Hilton. If you are arriving to terminal 1 and you donÂ´t have time to pick another hotel, then have in mind that the rooms are very old, small and in my case, the window had view to another building. Also the curtains were dirty... Really... donÂ´t choose this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not all rooms are good. Low ceiling, packed place, but well located.”
Reviews.Author: Hedin
Reviews.Content: I recommend to take the DeLuxe rooms -I tried both. Position is what matters, in order to have a silent area. nice breakfast and very kind service. It's a low ceiling area of the airport -it's for business travellers who need a practical location.

Reviews.Title: “Darn Noisy”
Reviews.Author: drknows
Reviews.Content: There seems to be constant work going on the floor below this hotel, either in the restaurants or the offices. Unfortunately, Hilton has agreed to allow airport personnal to perform these renos throughout the night. Having encountered this problem at this property in the past, I queried the front counter staff about this issue prior to accepting a room. They gave the usual semi-conscious stare of those who are instructed to not mention upcoming problems and stated there is no work being performed. The work began at 11 pm and lasted until 3 am. Needless to say, be prepared for banging, hammering, constant tapping of pipes, etc. and this type of work has been going on for years. This is not a hotel for a light or even medium sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Located in the terminal”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianStyle808
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic, but clean and located right upstairs in the international terminal. It is pricey, but you are paying for location. Highly recommend if you have an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Mexico City Business Trip Airport Stays”
Reviews.Author: andrew10412
Reviews.Content: Have been staying here on average once a month for the past two years. Hotel is usually packed on Thursday nights with people returning home to the states Friday mornings, so book in advance. Reception staff is great, and they treat elite members amazingly. Very good customer service and check-in lines have one person if any. If you need to leave before breakfast, they will pack you a boxed lunch. While this hotel may be older, it is light years ahead of the newly opened NH in T2. Even though I only fly out of T2, I go out of my way to stay at the Hilton in T1. Buffet is great, and included if you are elite. In their lounge they also have great views of the aircraft and airport operations. If you need to get to T2 before the tram starts working, they have a bus that operates in the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “OK for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: SNeaime
Reviews.Content: Nothing much different from others airport hotels: clean bed, clean shower. No "Hilton" feeling - it is ok for the price you pay...

Reviews.Title: “Only in emergency cases!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: -Smoking smell in the non-smoking room -unfriendly reception staff -overpriced -small room

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what you expect !”
Reviews.Author: Waldea
Reviews.Content: Lives up to expectations ! Characterless slightly small rooms, bur conveniently in the terminal building at a reasonable cost. Good buffet breakfast and pretty good service.

Reviews.Title: “I needed a little more room”
Reviews.Author: Bliszczcclan
Reviews.Content: Wish Hilton would post the room size on their website. I felt it was a bit on the small side. Need to do more research for a future jumping off point for early morning flights. Staff was friendly. If I were manager, I'd work on the cleanliness of the main areas. Not a good impression. Not the worst airport hotel I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Airport convenience with a Claustrophobic feel”
Reviews.Author: AngelSaskatchewan
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from Huatulco, Mexico and I had to spend one night in Mexico City due to flight changes and chose this hotel because of the location to the airport. I did not expect to feel that I was living in a bubble but that is what it was like. As another traveler indicated, there are no windows that open. After spending several weeks in paradise where you are constantly exposed to fresh air and can sleep with your windows open this can be a shock to the body. This building is part of the airport and it is like being in a cube. Around 6 am you hear the roar of the planes, the sounds of showers in other rooms, and the sound of doors slamming as people are leaving. The air seemed stale and I could not wait to get out. The carpets appeared worn and dated and this is the first hotel I have seen in Mexico that has carpets. I had to get outside to get some fresh air which was taxi fumes and airport fumes. There is no place to go for a walk and relax. The only positive was the comfy bed, but sleep wasn't great because of slamming doors throughout the night and the stale air. The morning buffet was good but overpriced. The service was fine and staff were welcoming and pleasant. I was glad to get out of this bubble and on a plane. If you are traveling and need to stay in Mexico City for air line connections you may want to consider what is important to your physical and mental comfort. This environment was convenient, but very hard after a relaxing vacation. I can only recommend this hotel for convenience but price and atmosphere are a two thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “No windows but delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: eyewash
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and me stayed there for two nights with 2 weeks in between. The Hilton is inside the airport very easy to access. Aisles are pretty long due to hotel footprint. The room was ok but nothing fancy and quite small. I did not like the fact that there was no window, probably only a psychologic issue that I have. The breakfast buffet was a blast. It was a mixture of continental and mexican. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, unfortunate bed bug situation”
Reviews.Author: CBerry80
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and loyal Hilton Honors member and unfortunately must say that outside of location this Hotel has little to offer by the way of what a guest should expect - particularly considering the price. To make matters worse, it appears there may be a bed bug issue at the hotel. I have stayed at this hotel multiple times over the last few months while dropping in on Mexico City on business. Many of those stays I have woken up with strange bites on my shoulders, arms and/or legs and feet. Again, I cannot be certain, but they appear to be bed bug bits (all in a line and appearing and worsening through the course of the day). This last trip from which I have just returned, staying the night of January 20th, 2011, is the last straw. I awoke with a few bites on my arms and by the end of the day have bites showing up all over my shoulders and arms. I will not be staying at this hotel again, at least not until there's an indication that the issue is under control. Really unfortunate as its otherwise very conveniently located and the gym, bar and restaurant and good, particularly considering the location. There's an NH nearby and a Camino Real onsite. Don't have experience there yet but, Hilton Honors member or not, I will certainly be giving them a try.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy, cannot get mgmt to respond to my complaint. Horrible service.”
Reviews.Author: MikeT63
Reviews.Content: Construction noise was so loud that sleep was impossible. I called during the night to complain but was told they could do nothing about the noise. Complained the next morning upon check-out and was offered a 10% discount and told that they didn't know about the construction. Upon returning home I checked the internet and found others who had complained about the construction noise long before my stay. Way below the standards that would should expect from a full service Hilton hotel. Many e-mails later, still no response. I guess a Gold member means nothing to Hilton anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive for a hotel in serious need of an uplift”
Reviews.Author: travel4workandplay
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 evening because I had an early morning flight out of Mexico City airport.. The hotel is located within one of the terminal buildings (the older of the 2) and I took a shuttle train over to the other terminal to catch my early morning flight. This hotel is very tired and below Hilton standard. The rooms have very old heating/a.c systems and these are very noisy, The food and the service in the hotel restaurant was faultless but for the money the hotel represented very poor value for money. I spotted other hotels within the terminal and if I wasn't a HHonors member then I would probably choose one of these in the future.

Reviews.Title: “For convenience only”
Reviews.Content: As with all Airport hotels I imagine you only stay at them because you have to in terms of convenience and timings and so it was for my stay here. The Hilton is located within the terminal building , it is decorated in a modern fashion with a Brasserie style restaurant in the lobby area. Bed was comfortable and the room was quiet if not a bit dull .You can check the flight arrivals/departures on the TV. Best feeling about staying at this hotel is waking up in the morning and only having to take the lift down to check in - stress free journey - stay here for this reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “We missed our connection, thank god we stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: alecheverry
Reviews.Content: First, me and my husband were coming back from Cancun on our way back to the States, but bad weather delayed our flight and we missed our connection and had to fly early on AA the next day. Good thing that this airport has this magnificent hotel inside the terminal: You really don't have to leave the premises at all! The staff is very friendly and courteous, especially RicArdo? at the front desk...He was able to remember our names without any problem! The rooms were very clean and comfy, the bed was great and allowed us to rest during the short stay; however, the bathrooms are a little small and lack space to move or change freely. I guess for business people on the road this hotel will be great! They start serving breakfast at 5:15 AM, allowing us to get a bite before our flight departed at 7:00 AM...the great thing is that the front desk is right there outside the hotel, so you don't have to worry about getting late to check in.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient spot for alyover”
Reviews.Author: richieeason
Reviews.Content: Great staff, free shuttle to T2, Very convenient, quiet, relaxed, great breakfast. Ideal spot for a layover on way to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: comit2excellence
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not only tired and overpriced for the pricing my room was also infested with bed-bugs. I stayed one night and was eaten up!

Reviews.Title: “Jack Hammer Blues”
Reviews.Author: Hexte
Reviews.Content: Convenient hotel located within terminal 1 and convenient for international flights. Rooms are dated and have a certain odor to them. There is a NH next door which might be worth a try. My complaint is construction. Couldn't go to sleep do to incessant pounding and drilling. I called the front desk to complain. I awoke 20 minutes later and the drill sounded like it was going off in my ear. Got up went to the desk and the night manager says they are building a restaurant. He moved me in the middle of the night but no compensation on the billing. His attitude was suck it up.......I can't do anything about it. Although I have stayed at this hotel in the past I will be looking for other places to lay my head in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hilton Standards!!!”
Reviews.Author: FridayTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel only had ONE advantage over other city hotels, it is extremely convenient when you have a short overnight connection. Other than that, I would avoid staying here. I was staying there on two separate nights this month and felt that Hilton took my business for granted and didn't value me as a gold member. (Next time I'm taking a car to the Polanco district hotels!) There is no Executive rooms nor a lounge and their "premium rooms" are identical to other regular rooms. My primary issue with the Hilton is that the rooms are mediocre; no view from many of the rooms, the staff is generally not very helpful when assigning rooms and there are serious shortcomings when it comes to comfort in the rooms. The hotel is built on a sprawling plan and some take quite some time to walk to, and staff appears to take glee in assigning them. The "free" breakfast is a real bright spot, try the Barbacoa and tortillas for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine!”
Reviews.Author: JBGall
Reviews.Content: We encountered none of the problems that the previous reviewer mentions on our layover stay at the Hilton. Our room was large and clean, and the hot water in the shower came on immediately and plentifully, Staff was helpful and pleasant. Restaurant service was a bit slow, but not a problem, and the servers were polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “worst hilton I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: austintraveler52
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and stay at Hilton's frequently--and this hotel is the single worst Hilton I have ever encountered in the chain. The rooms are small, smelly, and old. I don't think anything has been done to them for decades (think lime green cand thread-bear carpets). The water in the shower takes an extraordinary long time to warm up (fifteen minutes for luke-warm water and when you complain, the staff agrees, Hot water is never really hot here and and the plumbing is so old it takes a long time, they will tell you). The service is slow and non-rsponsive (they are understaffed). The restaurant staff is more interested in talking to one another than service. The only plus is that th hotel is right in the airport. But there is a much nicer Camino Real also connected the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a nice place, conveniently inside the airport, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: atomicon
Reviews.Content: We arrived with our two girls (aged 4 and 1 1/2) after 5 pm for an overnight stay before catching a very early flight the next morning. The service was excellent, with everyone being very accommodating to us. We booked an executive room (worth the little bit extra from the sound of some other reviews), and they offered us a choice of three different ones, showing them to us ahead of time. Room was clean and had everything we needed. The lights were a bit confusing, as you had to put your keycard in a slot by the door to turn on everything, but once we figured this out, it was all good. Porters carried all our luggage to and from the terminal. The bar area had a nice view of the runways at night, and even some rooms had the same view. Wireless internet was only in the bar/lobby area, if I recall. We didn't eat at the restaurant, so I can't comment on that, but the hotel's location is in an area of the airport with a lot of restaurants and shops very close by. It's almost like a shopping mall. Overall, I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “CONVENIENT, BUT THAT'S IT”
Reviews.Author: MELIXITALY
Reviews.Content: Perfect if you have to spend a night in Mexico between two flights, but you wouldn't say it's a Hilton - except for the price, of course. My room was right above an airport restaurant, and I could smell it. WiFi Internet for free, but not working for most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “convenient - but not Hilton standard”
Reviews.Author: jumpinhorsedad
Reviews.Content: if you have an early morning flight or very quick overnight turn around this airport hotel is situated perfect. close to international departures and check in. but do NOT expect Hilton or 4 or 5 stars - 3 at best.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible, not up to Hilton's usual standards”
Reviews.Author: Gobbledyspook
Reviews.Content: Just stayed overnight, a very short night with an early flight next morning, but not that pleasant. Expensive, smelly, old and need of refurbishment, didn't feel too clean, very impersonal, noisy. Convenient for the airport as it's right inside the terminal, but little else to recommend it. Didn't use any facilities, bar or restaurant, so can't comment. However, I'll be giving the (new, I think) NH hotel a try in the other terminal next time. If traffic in Mexico City weren't so bad, I'd be staying in town rather than here, but the airport is just too far out.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: PortMoodyGal2009
Reviews.Content: I preface this review with the fact that I fly frequently and spend roughly 150-180 nights a year in hotels, most often in Latin America, so I have a high tolerance for things not going as planned. There were 3 adults, two teenagers and my 10 month old baby in our party. Our connecting flight required us to overnight in Mexico City, so I booked and prepaid for 2 rooms for Jan 23rd through Hotels.ca. We arrived around 12:30am and were due to fly out at 7:25am in the morning. I had booked this hotel mainly because of its location right in the airport and because In general I have always had good experiences with Hilton (I used to stay frequently with them) . They assigned us rooms 203 and 207. Just as an FYI, both rooms are very small and while they have windows, there is no view of anything but a bamboo backdrop. I was not upset about this given we were spending such a short time there, but if you are claustrophobic, you may want to ask for a different view. In my room (207) the bathroom lights and TV were not functioning. We thought we could live with that given our short stay. Soon after we settled in, however, we noticed there was some sort of random banging (which ended up going on for the entire time we were there). The final straw, however, came at 4am, when an overpowering smell of raw sewage woke us up. It was still there when we checked out at 5:30am. My friend said the same banging and smell was in her room as well. On the plus side, the girl at the front desk was extremely nice and had us checked in very quickly. While a bit of a moot point, we did receive the automated wake up calls as promised (not always the case in Mexico) and the same girl even called us personally several minutes later to make sure we really were up. I have written about this experience to both Hilton and to Hotels.ca as I have have 2 upcoming prepaid bookings at the same hotel for a night on either end of an upcoming trip to Spain in February. I am concerned that one of the reasons we were assigned these rooms was because we had prepaid (non-refundable) through Hotels.ca and so Hilton felt as though they could stick us in the worst rooms... I will update and let you all know a) their response and b) if our next two stays go any better. Thanks, Seana

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: heyvalera
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, old and in a dire need of renovation. Rooms reminded me of some good old Days Inn somewhere in the rural Kentucky. Extremely overpriced - for half the price you can stay at a much better Hilton Reforma (former Sheraton Historico), even with two cab fares included. So if you travel internationally - keep in mind, that you will probably land at terminal 2, while the hotel is in Terminal 1 - you must pay 10 pesos for the bus service to get there - and with a suitcase that'd be tough to do, as there are no pathways to this bus (nor are there many signs). So get yourself a fixed price cab ride to the city and stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Over-night Stay”
Reviews.Author: travellinman2009
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is ideal if you have a late arrival or early flight departure. The staff were very friendly and helpful. But the rooms are in need of updating and fall a bit short of Hilton standards.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: Eweb
Reviews.Content: I've read some rather negative reviews of this hotel, but I really had no complaints. The staff was very friendly. The room, although small was very comfortable, as were the beds. The bathroom was nice, and any toiletries we may have needed were provided. We were there for just one night, as we had early flights the next day. I can't comment on the restaurant or bar, as we didn't use them. There's cheap, good food just out the doors of the hotel if you're concerned about prices.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Bezi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we had a late flight in to Mexico City and an early one out the next day. That is the only reason you would stay here. We found the room to be fine for one night. I disagree with a previous reviewer about the food however, I thought the food was awful. Most of the tables were not laid out and the area had an untidy look about it. Half my food was cold and had to be sent back, but that didn't help as it was still inedible. My tip would be to eat at the airport restaurants down below as the the food will be cheaper and better.

Reviews.Title: “Bottom line Hilton Quality”
Reviews.Author: Planedriver
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located inside Mexico City airport, which is a big plus. The reception area and restaurant look very decent with good service, but the rooms completely lack that Hilton Quality feel to it. Perhaps they have other more recently renovated rooms, but our room looked tired and our toilet kept blocking up, and after the 3rd time being 'fixed', we gave up since it was time to check out anyway. They blamed it on lack of water pressure. Certainly, they could fit a central waterpump to run showers and toilets at higher pressure. Breakfast is very nice with freshly squeezed orange juice and eggs cooked to you liking by a chef, but it is rather expensive although kids pay half or nothing at all (depending on age). Internet access is free if you bring your own laptop and ask for the access code. Beds are comfortable, but one side of the hotel is exposed to noise from the airport announcements. It would be advisable to ask for a QUIET room.

Reviews.Title: “Possible criminal infiltration”
Reviews.Author: Victim_of_Mexico
Reviews.Content: The only reason I gave any stars is that it is impossible to give it zero stars, which is what it deserves!! We booked our room on the internet and had the receipt with us. The check-in went well and we were told that breakfast was included. In the middle of the night, someone slipped a new bill under our door, but I didn't think it important as we had a prearranged rate. I thought I could straighten out any misunderstanding when we left in the morning. We ate the "included" breakfast and then tried to leave. That is when we were blocked from doing so by two men. We were forced to pay the new room rate which was about $100 more than our confirmation stated. We were also forced to pay about $50 each for our "free" breakfast. We were not allowed to leave until we did so. I don't know for sure, but it seemed to me the Mexican mafia was shaking us down. Perhaps they have infiltrated this hotel. If you are really so brave as to stay at this hotel after reading my review, you only have yourself to blame. Steer well clear of this hotel. It may seem convenient to overnight at the airport in Mexico City by booking at the Hilton, but it is a trap. We thought we would be safe staying at what we assumed was a reputable hotel. Boy were we ever wrong!! Thousands of Canadians are being shaken down in Mexico, even though we have a Free Trade Agreement with them. My advice to ANYONE would be to skip Mexico altogether. Don't even transfer in that country. We are so disappointed and feel so betrayed by our false friend, Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “good stop point to get over jet lag”
Reviews.Author: blinker09
Reviews.Content: i came off the long british flight and could not guarantee my connection so thought i would stay over night at the hilton, really quiet which is quite suprising for the airport, i ahd a room facing the main road next to the airport and it was really quite which suprised me, very happy staff, the only thing i thought was it was abit pricey, rooms are big and very comfortable bed, they helped with everything from luggage to warning me the time about my connecting flight the next morning overall a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: PetroniusMinor
Reviews.Content: Convenient when connection needs overnight stay; actually in terminal but no lift from ground floor (arrivals) to first floor (departures) where there is a lift up to Hilton. You have to carry your cases up an escalator. Horrible smell in lobby but room ok -- standard 3/4 star -- very expensive for what you get. I bought a "Romance Package"(!!!) because it seemed (on the Hilton web-site) better value for b&b and included "champagne on arrival". Our room was ready but when I asked about breakfast it became clear that we were booked in on a "room only"basis. They asked us to wait a "few minutes more" to "prepare" the room for our "Romance Package" (sprinkling rose petals?), annoying because we were tired after a long flight and delays with luggage etc.15 minutes later we were taken up to our standard room and told that our "amenities would arrive in a few minutes". One hour after checking in and a couple of phone calls later half a bottle of Spanish Cava and four chocolate covered strawberries arrived!!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: tecouag
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice location inside Mexico City Airport this is a nice option. Anyhow let me advice you, the price is really high compared with other nice hotels in Mexico city with bigger rooms. The rooms are really small

Reviews.Title: “Good for what you need”
Reviews.Author: SouperK
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel as other reviewers have noted, but I didn't think it was so old that it was terrible. The staff is friendly and willing to help and the beds are really comfortable. The heat works fine and there are TV Channels in English. To me, it's better to stay here than to get stuck on the Periferico in traffic, wondering if you're going to make your flight or be trying to get around in Mexico City at 4 a.m. Do keep in mind that there is a new airport terminal in the Mexico City airport so there are now TWO terminals and the hotel is in the older terminal. The hotel is located in what is called the "International" terminal, but we were flying internationally to the U.S. and went out from the new terminal. I don't know why and didn't ask anyone so I'm not sure what I'm missing there. But, should this happen to you, just know that the new terminal is NOT right next door to the old terminal. You can't walk there. You have to either take the tram, shuttle or a taxi and it's about a 5-minute ride on the tram. You can walk to the tram from the hotel and it's about a 5 minute walk inside the airport, but the hotel bellboys can only take you so far due to union rules (we were told) so think about this if you have a lot of bags. There is also a limit to the number of bags you can take on the tram and there is security at the entrance checking on that. The front desk at this Hilton should familarize themselves with the policy a little better also. Everyone knew there was a limit to the number of bags but no one knew what the number was. Also everyone had a different opinion on what was the best way to get to the other terminal so they should really all be better briefed on that. Considering that we would have had to get up at 3 a.m. and drive to the airport if we didn't stay at this hotel, I am pretty happy that it was there. If you are traveling with an infant I would recommend trying to bring your own pack-n-play. They do have portable cribs but I don't think they would pass the safety standards in the U.S. One of the other reviewers below had mentioned another hotel that is connected to the airport. I didn't know about that one, but if the Hilton is booked, that may be an option.

Reviews.Title: “Another Old Hilton”
Reviews.Author: drumbumcanada
Reviews.Content: Old, Old, Old. Only stay there if you HAVE to. Being in the airport itself is easy and convient to get to. The food at the restaurant is quite good though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for transit”
Reviews.Author: JimmyD73
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We stayed here due to late arrivals and early departures so we didn't really get to use the facilities. Excellent location as it's right inside the terminal and close to the terminal restaurants and facilities. Nice, clean rooms and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - very convenient”
Reviews.Author: MDFreqTvlr
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel even for an airport hotel. It is conveniently located in Terminal 1 but only a quick train ride to Terminal 2. Given the uncertainties of Mexico City traffic, I highly recommend the hotel for anyone with a morning flight. The staff is outstanding. They took care of every thing I needed and even upgraded me to a mini suite for a little more room. At check out they checked me in on my flight and printed out my boarding passes. Overall a very good experience and you don't even realize you are in an airport hotel until you get off the elevator into the Terminal.

Reviews.Title: “You could do a lot WORSE”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: Like most folks, we just had a one night layover in Mexico City before heading off to Acapulco. We found the hotel to be clean, well maintained and comfortable. The 24 hour 7-11 in the airport lobby just below was an added bonus. If we were to return to the property, the only request we would have would be a room which overlooks the terminal rather than the street which approaches the airport. Rooms on the street side have double-paned glass (to insulate the noise), which get so dirty from the smog that they are opaque ... and there is nothing really to see anyway. The breakfast buffet is good, and well-presented. (I can understand the frustration of the people who arrived in the newly-completed, Terminal 2 ... but realize that this is not the Hilton's fault ... in addition to the train, there are Suburban-like shuttles which will take you back to Terminal 1). Finally, YES, the rooms are small ... but pleasant, and quiet. There are some dicey hotels around Mexico City, some of which require a pricey cab ride. If you are there only overnight - this should be your only choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel-Clean!”
Reviews.Author: cvhdvd
Reviews.Content: For an airport hotel the Hilton Mexico City Airport is great! The staff is wonderful and is able to help with any request. Rooms are a bit small, however I had a king bed, desk and chair in mine with room to move around. The bathrooms were CLEAN and NICE! The cleaning staff does a great job with fresh water every morning. The hotel is on the third floor so it is quite safe with Hilton security in the lobby. Great business center with two computers and wireless connection available throughout the hotel. (no wired ports in the room) If you are here for a week as I was I would recommend booking a room with the breakfast buffet! It is great and custom order. If you want anything else just take the elevator down to the main hall and you have a mini city with everything you could imagine to eat. Local to American! You have it here! Workout facility is clean and nice. The only downfall I found was with the smoke of the airport. I stayed in a non-smoking room however there are no real smoking laws in Mexico City. Although the room was smoke free smoke comes in from the main airport check-in and the lobby. I don't think there is much the Hilton can do about this. This is the first hotel I have stayed in that I did not want to rip the comforter off the bed when I arrived! It was spotless! Room comes with a small electronic safe in the closet that is great for the passport and cash, however if you have a laptop, don't plan on leaving it at the hotel. Flight Check-in counters are at the bottom of the escalator-Easy! If you have business at the airport or are transferring through I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like? I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: edved23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Mexico and while this is not the cheapest it certainly is one of the most American like hotels around. No beating around the bush, the hotel bes are very comfortable. The comforters the pillows and the mattress are of much better quality than other hotels in Mexico. While this location is not ideal if you have an early flight or are just heading to Mexico City and heading back out quickly it is well worth the price. Recap - comfortable room - best airport location available - good service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Mitsuru
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently two times in last May and June. As I had saw several negative comments on this hotel, I was afraid that my stay could be also not very much comfortable. But in reality, I found no problem and became to love this hotel a lot for the following reason. 1)Location is naturally excellent. After having checked in early in the morning at the the Airport, I could returned and had very pleasant breakfast at this hotel. 2)Room was comfortable and clean. I had stayed before at Camino Real but Hilton's room was much better. 3)Staff was also very friendly. I will definitely return to this hotel in case I make transit at Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Mexico city airport”
Reviews.Author: Carriacou
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there on several occasions. I do find the hotel to be noisy. A couple of times they were doing some renovations on the departure level and the hammering went on all night. If you get a room overlooking the interior of the airport you hear announcements all night long. Stay at the Camino Real. It is connected to the airport by an pedestrian overpass and far superior for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive, but incredibly convenient and unique!”
Reviews.Author: Mike-Wiesner
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this hotel twice, booking through hotels.com, and find it to be a ultra-convenient and unique experience. Most imporant: I have NEVER experienced a bad smell! My room smelled perfectly fresh each time. Upon check in I was handed a card-key within seconds of giving them my name - with absolutely no paperwork or anything. I went straight to my room. The first time it was slightly far, no big deal, and faced the inside. This was unique, actually looking down on people walking to their gates. Dead silent, though. The second time my room was 103, facing the outside, but right by the lobby. This was noisy, so I asked for a room further away, and was handed another card-key within seconds. This room, I believe to the left, was still close, and faced the outside. Planes taking off right outside my window. Slight noise, but not a problem (good windows), and still unique. The room was like every other Hilton I have ever been in. Some rooms, though, are larger than others, but absolutely comfortable in every way. I prefer rooms with character in old colonial hotels, but for one night before my 7:20 am flight back to the U.S., it was great! That's the key point. You are in the airport, minutes from check in. I went down early (4am - but I'm a bit nuts), checked in, and went back to my room for coffee. Most unique, you are right in the airport. To really appreciate it, you must see Tom Hank's film, The Terminal. When you step out of the elevator in the hotel lobby, you are in the middle of the restaurant area. Strange place to spend the evening. There are buses directly from and to the airport from a number of cities. I always go directly to Puebla or Queretaro, and directly back. I have not been in Mexico City at all on my last four trips. I will definitely do this again on my next trip, and stay at the Airport Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “The good the bad the ugly”
Reviews.Author: Penguin23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on three seperate occasions here is what i have learned. The first tiem i stayed at the hotel my room was to the left of the checkout, the windows were on the inside of the airport and it was a mile away NIGHTMARE, on my latest visit i realized i had signed up before as a hilton gold member they gave me a room to the right it was much newer and nicer and only 2 minutes from the lobby, the room service was fast and not too bad. My advice ask for a room to the right ask for an outside window. For a connecting flight there is no better place to stay its like 10 minutes from luggage to check in to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly simple and basic for a "Hilton" chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: thedonk
Reviews.Content: I expected more from this hotel. It's expensive only for its location. My room was small and a little run down. Restaurant food was fine. Location is good for anyone arriving late or leaving early, but besides that I would recommend something other than this hotel. SAFE TRAVELS - thedonk

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever known”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is definitely overpriced for its quality. What's more, the management is pathetic. They charged me a deposit of $100 dollars to make phone calls, and instead of giving that back to me at check-out, they deducted it from my bank account. I've been communicating with them but they are so slow and inefficient, and I still have not gotten the money back. Two months have already passed since. I don't even want to recall this terrible experience....

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: lookmeupinaz
Reviews.Content: The last reviewer was exactly right about this hotel. Sewage smells coming from the bathroom, rooms that overall are not Hilton quality. If you are arriving late into MEX and absolutely don;t want to have to take a late night cab ride to the main hotels on Reforma or in Polanco, then be prepared for an overpriced disappointment. the convenience factor is unbeatable as long as you know what you are getting into. Since construction is ongoing near the hotel entrance, good luck even finding your way to the elevator. And forget about internet access....I have never seen such outrageously priced access ($20 for 2 hours!!!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Explore Other Options”
Reviews.Author: GlobalEyes
Reviews.Content: The convenience of a hotel within an airport is a huge draw so, despite the bad reviews, I chose to stay at the Hilton Mexico City Airport against better judgement. In hindsight, despite a late flight in and an afternoon flight out, I would have taken a cab from the terminal to another hotel. For the price one pays at this Hilton, it is awful accomodation. The sewage smell (I'm not exaggerating) emanating from the bathroom and the dank and dirty room, overall, were certainly tough to swallow considering it has the Hilton name (and price). Unless you're absolutely bent on convenience, I strongly suggest you look at alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient But Not Up To Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: maisany
Reviews.Content: After a long flight, never having been to Mexico City before, and only speaking a smattering of Spanish, it was very convenient for me to simply get through immigration and customs, walk down the terminal corridor, and go up a couple of escalators and an elevator to arrive at my hotel. Unfortunately, after I'd been in my room and unpacked, I discovered that the lights in the bathroom did not work. I was too tired and it was too late to try and switch rooms so I managed by the hall light, but it was definitely a bother. I only stayed one night, and overall, my room was fine. The A/C worked really well, which for me was a very good thing. With the entire airport concourse below, you had a lot of options as far as food. They called me a taxi the next day for my meeting and I later discovered on my trip back that their taxi charged me about double what another service charged me to drive me back (350 pesos versus 180). Not a huge difference dollar-wise, but still something to beware of. They had WiFi access in the room, but to connect, you had to call the front desk to get a passcode. Again, not a big deal but given other existing technologies, an unnecessary complication. All in all, considering that this was a Hilton-brand property and not one of their budget brands, I was underwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “left hotel very sick”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i awakened very ill from the heavy sewer smell in the room. the rest of the hotel seemed okay. my wife and i were throwing up, having the runs, dehydrated and full of aches/pains. the hotel thinks that there is nothing wrong with this. i was literally denied boarding to head back to dfw because of my condition. i begged and begged and was able to convince the captain i could fly. the hilton has yet to answer my complaint or refund my stay. they also have medical bills to pay. the best part was that this hotel does not speak any english. save yourself the hassle, i heard the marriott is the place to stay. i also have booked the sheration at ----- before and that was great.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very expensive, not great service or food. But the conveniance is impossible to beat. So if you are anxious about your safety, want to avoid cab costs going to a hotel in the city and need a place to stay in Mexico this works. I have stayed here a number of times because you just can't beat the conveniance.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last night, for an early morning connection. Very convenient, but expensive. And the room was sweltering - the air never really cooled it off. I'm trying the Airport Marriot for my upcoming trip.
